definition: to love and respect/love and respect
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

sentences.english: The teacher's democratic attitude made her popular among her pupils.
sentences.chinese: 该教师平等待人的态度时她受到了学生的爱戴。

sentences.english: Jieyou lived in Wusun for more than 50 years and enjoyed the love and respect of the Wusun people.
sentences.chinese: 她在乌孙国生活了五十多年，深受乌孙人民的爱戴。

sentences.english: The next day, Ed visited a famous statesman who was respected by people.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，爱德拜访了一位著名的人民爱戴的政治家。

sentences.english: With good stability and high output, Huihong Machinery are recognized and favored by the industry.
sentences.chinese: 辉鋐机器稳定性佳，产量高，深受业界的认同与爱戴。

sentences.english: Before long, the one-hundredth prince gained the respect and affection of all.
sentences.chinese: 没过多久，第一百位王子就得到所有人的尊敬和爱戴。

sentences.english: The teacher's democracy made her popular among her pupils.
sentences.chinese: 教师的民主作风使她受到学生的爱戴。

sentences.english: He will follow the good Siddartha loved by the people.
sentences.chinese: 他要追随人所爱戴的杰出的悉达多。

sentences.english: He explains why Beverly Sills became America's beloved diva .
sentences.chinese: 他解释了为什么希尔斯能成为美国最受爱戴的演员。

sentences.english: Up and down the country people more loved lill princess.
sentences.chinese: 全国上下的人民更加爱戴莉儿公主了。

sentences.english: And yet that's what we strive for, in loving God.
sentences.chinese: 但这却是我们在爱戴上帝的同时所追求的。

sentences.english: The veteran worker ranks high in public love and esteem.
sentences.chinese: 那位老工人深受大伙的爱戴。

sentences.english: The Neapolitan fans had with Diego a relationship based on affection and love, honoring him as a God.
sentences.chinese: 他赢得了那不勒斯队球迷们的爱戴，称他为足球之神。

sentences.english: The teacher has won the love and esteem of his (or her) students.
sentences.chinese: 这位老师关心同学，严以律己，深受学生们的爱戴。

sentences.english: David Attenborough is one of Britain's best-loved TV presenters.
sentences.chinese: 大卫艾登堡是深受英国观众爱戴的电视主持人之一。

sentences.english: I feel very loved in Italy but less so when I am with Les Bleus.
sentences.chinese: 我在意大利很受爱戴，但在法国国家队却并非如此。

sentences.english: A good teacher, she is loved by all of her pupils.
sentences.chinese: 因为她是个好老师，所以受到全体学生的爱戴。

definition: to admire/to revere/to look up to
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
to trust/to have confidence in/to have faith in/to rely on
to receive in no small measure
